title: Saudi Arabia's record deficit - BBC News
summary: saudi arabia unveils budget amid oil falls .
uk flooding 'could reduce economic growth by 0.2 % ' .
uk boxing day shopping shows slight increase .

documents.title: goodbye
text: that 's all from the bbc business live page today - a little shorter than usual because of the holiday period .

but join me tomorrow from 7am when i 'll be bringing you expectations of us house prices for october , and reminiscing on the year past with the italian prime minister 's end of year news conference .

documents.title: us entrepreneur on saving mozambique 's wildlife
text: gorongosa national park in mozambique has wildlife which suffered greatly after the ravages of civil war - but us tech entrepreneur greg carr told bbc world service 's business daily programme that despite the fact that `` most of the animals had been eaten '' , he still had hopes to revive it .

documents.title: saudi revenue from oil down
text: in a statement , saudi arabia 's ministry of finance wrote :
`` the oil revenues are expected to reach sr 444.5 billion , representing 73 % of the total revenue .
`` this is 23 % less than oil revenue during the previous fiscal year ( 2014 ) '' .

documents.title: saudi plans 2016 spending cuts
text: saudi arabia also announced plans to shrink its record state budget deficit with spending cuts , and a drive to raise revenues from sources other than oil , reports reuters news agency .
next year 's budget projects spending of 840bn riyals , down from 975bn spent this year .
the original budget plan for 2015 projected spending of 860bn riyals .
revenues next year are forecast at 514bn riyals , down from revenues of 608bn riyals in 2015 .
this year 's original budget plan envisaged 715bn riyals of revenues .

documents.title: saudi 's record deficit 'acceptable ' - official
text: as saudi arabia posts a record $ 98bn budget deficit for 2015 , saudi 's council of economic and development affairs said the figure was `` considered an acceptable figure '' under the circumstances , with oil languishing at multi-year lows , hindi bin abdullah al-suhaimi , an advisor to the council , told a media briefing .

state spending in 2015 totalled 975bn riyals , more than the 860bn riyals originally planned because of extra spending such as a salary bonus for public employees that marked the accession of king salman in january , reports reuters news agency .
revenues this year totalled 608bn riyals , less than the original target of 715bn riyals as prices for oil , on which the economy depends , fell further than expected .
officials are due to announce saudi arabia 's 2016 budget plan later in the afternoon .

documents.title: saudi arabia posts record deficit amid oil price plummet
text: saudi arabia posted a record $ 98bn budget deficit in 2015 due to the sharp fall in oil prices , the finance ministry said today , ahead of revealing its full budget for 2016 , reports afp news agency .

revenues were estimated at 608bn riyals ( $ 162bn ) , well below projections and 2014 income , while spending came in at 975bn riyals ( $ 260bn ) , ministry officials announced at a press conference in riyadh .

documents.title: saudi budget : expect pullbacks on public spending
text: as the oil price falls and producer saudi arabia loses revenue , its government is expected to announce a big deficit , says analyst crispin hawes from teneo intelligence .
he told bbc news that in the saudi budget later , we should expect less spending on infrastructure projects , state sector subsidies and welfare .
author: BBC News Channel

documents.title: the most coveted finance jobs of 2016
text: the most in-demand job roles in the financial world will be oil and gas bankers , reckons bloomberg .

its analysts said that the energy industry is ripe for consolidation amidst plummeting prices , so merger and acquisition activity will likely be heavy in the coming year - and so oil and gas bankers will be `` leaned-on '' during this activity .
it also said jobs in fintech - technology in finance - and wealth management jobs will be on the rise .

documents.title: ghosts in the world 's deepest mine
text: the mponeng gold mine in south africa is haunted by `` ghost miners '' with sticky fingers , as bbc world service 's business daily finds out

documents.title: uk 's biggest house price rises
text: the london borough of newham , home to the olympic stadium , enjoyed the biggest rise in house prices across the uk in 2015 , according to the halifax .
the average house price there rose 22.2 % over the year compared with 2014 .
homes in newham , situated five miles east of the city of london , are now worth an average £ 319,522 as against £ 261,399 previously .
wales fared far worse , with merthyr tydfil and colwyn bay topping the list of worst performing areas for 2015 .
read more on the bbc business site .

documents.title: star wars anticipates big china demand
text: star wars film the force awakens opens in china , the world 's second biggest movie market , on jan 9 , and producers say they anticipate it will play `` very very well '' in the country .
director j.j. abrams watched the chinese premiere in shanghai with a chinese audience last night .
he said today that he was thrilled to see people `` laughing and cheering '' as audiences elsewhere have done .
the latest star wars film has raked in around $ 1bn worldwide .

documents.title: saudi budget amidst oil fall
text: saudi arabia is due to reveal its budget later , amidst the plummeting oil price .
the oil producing giant has today been accused by russia of `` destabilising '' the global oil market by increasing production despite the falling price , reports reuters news agency .

documents.title: amazon 's bumper christmas
text: amazon has told us their top 10 best-selling products for christmas :
1.. 25 by adele ( music )
2.. fire tablet , 7 '' , wi-fi , 8gb
3.. fire tv stick
4.fallout 4 ( gaming )
5.call of duty : black ops iii ( gaming )
the online retailing giant also said that it saw `` record-breaking '' figures for its prime service , which offers fast delivery and other benefits .
it also said that the top book purchased on its kindle devices in 2015 was the girl on the train : a novel by paula hawkins .

documents.title: rent-a-monk amazon service 'offends '
text: amazon 's rent-a-monk service in japan has offended buddhists , who have asked the web giant to stop the service , saying it is `` commercialising a religious act '' , reports the daily telegraph .
the online retailer has been advertising packages for a service which sends out holy men to perform buddhist memorial services and other events .
the complainants have questioned `` amazon 's attitude to religion '' .

documents.title: peston 's of the yearformer bbc business editor robert peston tweets :
text: i wonder if you can guess which of my radio highlights was my absolute favourite @ twitterid # pickoftheyear
@ twitterid @ twitterid i enjoyed it , but you should n't have gone !
@ twitterid @ twitterid so much great radio too hard to choose man with hand cut off ?

it 's you !

got ta be

documents.title: no more qe for europe in 2016 - financial times
text: the financial times writes on its front page that economists doubt the european central bank will increase its €1.46tn asset buying programme in 2016 - despite president mario draghi 's promises that it could be extended if needed to help the eurozone economy .

it surveyed economists who said that they expect higher growth rates and higher inflation in the coming year - so unless something goes seriously wrong in the global economy , they do n't expect more help from the central bank .

documents.title: today programme highlights
text: all this week , the today programme has been guest edited by rohan silva ( @ silva ) co-founder of second home and former adviser to david cameron .
you can listen back to some of this week 's highlights from the programme on the today website .

documents.title: 'business talent scouting is old-fashioned '
text: `` talent and the way we approach it has n't really evolved since the 1940 's , '' says lesley uren from pa consulting , which has new research out based on surveying 71 chief executives , which showed that the main gripe among them was the lack of getting top business talent .
ms uren told the today programme that one of businesses biggest failures is succession planning .

`` we need to be looking widely across businesses to find new and emerging skills for the future workplace - like digital skills - rather than looking for people to succeed current job roles which may not exist in 10 years from now , '' she said .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: china 'to limit local government debt ' and cut business tax
text: china will `` reasonably '' set limits on new local government debt in 2016 and in the coming years , the country 's finance minister lou jiwei said in a statement today , reports reuters news agency .
china will adopt a more flexible fiscal policy , including gradually increasing fiscal deficit ratio and expanding its budget deficit .
he added that the government would cut taxes to help companies reduce their burdens .

documents.title: china fines global shipping firms for price-fixing
text: chinese regulators have fined seven major international shipping companies 407m yuan ( $ 65m ; £ 42m ) for fixing prices after a year-long investigation .
korean , japanese and european shipping companies that carry vehicles were found to have coordinated bids and routes in order to keep prices high .
the fines are equivalent to 4 % to 9 % of the firm 's international shipping sales to and from china , the regulator said .
authorities have been penalising firms under china 's 2008 anti-monopoly law .
read more on the bbc business site .

documents.title: 2016 crystal ball gazing
text: in the coming year , avoid the fang , predicts market analyst justin urquhart stewart on wake up to money .
f.a.n.g is facebook , amazon , netflix and google , who have been the fashion over 2015 .
justin says that the biggest change will come from oil and mining , which have both been plummeting - but we need to watch movements there , especially as china 's oil demand slowly increases .
justin adds that politically , 2016 will be exciting , but not financially .
author: BBC 5Live

documents.title: uk festive shopping footfall increases
text: there was a 12 % rise in people going to shops over boxing day in the uk , according to retail analysts at springboard .

diane where told wake up to money that although it 's a brilliant result , it has to be put in to context - although it 's a rise compared with last year , boxing day last year actually saw a 9 % drop , so really `` we 've just bounced back to where we were with a little improvement '' .
she said that we 're not in to pre-recession footfall levels either .
she also said that there is a long term fall in footfall in retail destinations because of online shopping .
author: BBC 5Live

documents.title: asian shares close mixed
text: it was a mixed for asian shares at the start of a week shortened by holidays , amid quiet trade as japanese shares lead the region 's gains .
the benchmark nikkei 225 index was up 0.1 % to 18,792.67 despite economic data painting a gloomier of the world 's third largest economy .
data showed japan 's factory output fell 1 % in november from the previous month , marking the first fall in three months .
retail sales also fell below forecasts and declined 1 % from a year ago

documents.title: uk flooding could affect economic growth
text: analysts at ihs say that winter flooding in the uk could wipe off between 0.1 % - 0.2 % of the uk 's gdp - justin urquhart stewart told wake up to money that the damage the floods do to business confidence and morale is most damaging .
he adds that with the high number of small and medium businesses setting up in the uk , something like floods could wipe some of them out altogether .
author: BBC 5Live
